tag_to_content.h3_0: Funding the Now, Transforming the Future
tag_to_content.h2_3: Approx. $198.4bn of venture capital was allocated to US startups in 2022, but only 1.9% was allocated to female-founded startups, with .05% going to Black and Latinx women founders each.
tag_to_content.h2_4: Diverse founding teams deliver higher returns to investors by
tag_to_content.h2_5: For the last 5 years less than 3.0% of funding has gone to female founded start-ups, and the trend is only getting worse.

tag_to_content.p_17: Inclusively’s recruitment platform connects job seekers who benefit from workplace accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) with employers committed to inclusive workplaces.

tag_to_content.p_19: Health In Her HUE is a digital health platform that connects black women and WOC to culturally competent and sensitive healthcare providers, provides healthcare content, and provides a community for women to connect with other like-minded women.

tag_to_content.title: About | Purple Sage Ventures
tag_to_content.p_6: Underrepresented founders are undervalued and underfunded - and yet, research shows diverse teams produce better results. We see value and real returns in these founders.
tag_to_content.p_7: PSV does an exceptional job providing high-level strategic input and putting structure around different challenges that early-stage companies face. The team is great at providing guidance, input, and support during what is typically an incredibly chaotic phase.
tag_to_content.h5_1: Meet the Champions for Equality in Funding
tag_to_content.p_8: Liz began her career as an early employee at The Princeton Review. After working in management consulting, she joined the founding team of Bigfoot Interactive, an early innovator of B2C email marketing, built for Fortune 1000 companies. She went on to co-found Section 101, a scalable website platform for large music and entertainment clients. Before launching Purple Sage Ventures, Liz was involved with several other start-ups as both an investor and advisor.
tag_to_content.p_10: Liz sits on the boards of the Lang Center for Entrepreneurship at Columbia Business School and the Georgetown Entrepreneurship Advisory Group. She is the current board chair of the Georgetown Angel Investor Network, serves as the Pitch Coach in Residence at the Columbia Startup Lab, is a mentor for the Atlantic Council’s empowerME initiative, and lectures at her alma maters. Liz is passionate about helping diverse founders grow successful companies that yield significant returns while having big societal impacts.

img_2.alt: Photo of Purple Sage Venture's founder, Liz Leahy

tag_to_content.p_11: Susan spent 20+ years working for top-tier financial firms on Wall Street. She led global teams of systems development professionals building back office and international systems, as well as developing the product, content, and rollout strategy for the banks’ online delivery platforms.She has been on both sides of the funding table. She was a master fundraiser and operator in educational advancement in New York City, where she was responsible for major campaigns, while instituting best-in-class processes and procedures. At PSV, she leads the portfolio management and stewardship program for our incredible portfolio companies.
tag_to_content.p_12: Alex comes to Purple Sage Ventures from HiredScore, an innovative AI-based HR Tech growth company supporting the Fortune 500. As the Chief of Staff to the CEO, she directly advised the executive team, evaluated strategic partnerships and was responsible for creating best-in-class processes to achieve operational excellence. At PSV, Alex finds and helps select the next wave of extraordinary founders for Purple Sage’s portfolio, and connects with other funders, accelerators and partners that are motivated to democratize access to capital.Alex is passionate about early-stage startups and is a mentor at XRC Labs. She graduated with honors from Georgetown University’s undergraduate McDonough School of Business while also earning a certificate from the Walsh School of Foreign Service.
tag_to_content.h6_3: AIR HOCKEY CHAMP & MASTER OF PITHY COMMENTS
tag_to_content.p_13: Katy is a highly accomplished communications executive who comes to Purple Sage Ventures from many years of working in the music industry. Katy was the VP of Publicity at Sanctuary Records, Director of PR at both Hollywood Records and Universal Republic and had the pleasure of working with artists such as John Mellencamp, Duran Duran, Robert Plant, CAKE and many more. These days, she is making ‘rock stars’ out of PSV’s portfolio companies with her skill for content curation, digital marketing and writing.
tag_to_content.p_14: AJ is currently the Associate Director of the Columbia Startup Lab. He also works with the Senior Director and Special Advisor to the University president, scaling Columbia Entrepreneurship’s fundraising and alumni engagement efforts to match its growth. Passionate about increasing access to entrepreneurship and investing, AJ established the Black Founders Network, an inclusive community for Black entrepreneurs at all stages of their journey.
tag_to_content.p_15: Prior to PSV, Rajiv was a Wealth Management Advisor with Merrill Lynch. At PSV, he helps to source new deals, conduct due diligence and identify macro trends. He is currently an MBA candidate at Georgetown University McDonough School of Business. Rajiv is a member of the leadership team for Pockets of Promise, a non-profit organization helping underserved children in India and Africa.
tag_to_content.p_16: Derived from our experiences and the attributes we look for in founders
tag_to_content.p_17: is a combination of the fiery energy of red and the calmness of blue. It represents the passion to build something successful measured with the ability to remain calm, focused and thoughtful. When we agree to invest in a start-up, these boxes are checked.
tag_to_content.p_18: has more than one meaning; it is a person who is wise, or can share wisdom through experience, as well as someone who uses good judgment when faced with a decision. With years of experience, we strive to bring advice to our portfolios.
tag_to_content.p_19: are defined as "a journey" and can often be associated with risk. The word fits in perfectly with PURPLE (passion) and SAGE (wisdom), as we go on a journey with our portfolio companies as they take on the thrill of entrepreneurship.

Impactful products & services that innovate supply chains, increase business and
personal productivity, and reimagine wellness
tag_to_content.h6_8: Teams that act and lead with intention
tag_to_content.h6_9: Supporting our portfolio companies’ growth journey through Series A and B participation purplesageventures.com

tag_to_content.title: FAQ | Purple Sage Ventures
tag_to_content.p_6: Purple Sage Ventures was born out of the desire to drive rapid change in the funding landscape for underrepresented founders. We’re an early stage fund that invests in seed and Series A stage companies that are post-launch, with at least 6 months of revenue or some customer traction.
tag_to_content.h3_3: What sectors or industries does Purple Sage Invest in?
tag_to_content.p_7: We invest in products/services that innovate supply chains, increase business and personal productivity, and reimagine wellness - all with the goal of making big impacts.
tag_to_content.h3_4: What stage of company does Purple Sage invest in?
tag_to_content.p_8: Seed stage companies that are post-launch, with at least 6 months of revenue or some customer traction. We also support our portfolio companies’ growth journey through Series A and B participation.
tag_to_content.p_9: We only invest in companies that are domiciled and operating in the U.S., with a specific focus on the Northeast.
tag_to_content.h3_6: What companies have you invested in?
tag_to_content.p_10: We’re incredibly proud of the changemakers we’ve invested in - feel free to peruse the list here.
tag_to_content.h3_7: How does Purple Sage support its portfolio companies?
tag_to_content.p_11: As founders-turned-funders, we’ve been there. At the highest level we provide access to networks, knowledge, and capital. In addition, we support brand building, company growth, and fundraising.
tag_to_content.p_12: YEAH! If you’re a female and/or underrepresented founder or founding team member of an early-stage, post-launch company with products/services that innovate supply chains, increase business and personal productivity, and reimagine wellness with at least 6 months of revenue or some customer traction, submit to pitch pitch here.
tag_to_content.h3_9: How do I submit to pitch?
tag_to_content.p_13: Please fill out this form and a member of the investment team will be in touch.
tag_to_content.h2_1: WHAT TO KNOW BEFORE YOU SUBMIT TO PITCH
